stories.text:
I've been in several organizations where the developers have chosen fun or silly team names, rather than names that actually describe what they do.

I think it results in a lot of confusion within the organization and additional onboarding friction for new hires.

On the flip side, I acknowledge that it can be a morale booster and gives teams a way to express themselves.

Is there a way to meet in the middle here, or do you just have to weigh the pros and cons and choose fun vs. functional team names?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you meet devs in the middle about 'fun' team names?
